III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or about 2 days ago, a youth was slapped in their face by an
unknown staff member and pushed to the ground. The youth was
also punched two times by another youth at the facility. The youth
went AWOL two days ago but will return to the facility today. The
youth is fearful of returning.
Investigation Phone messages were exchanged with Complainant on
September 2, 2025. Through the messages Complainant
reported they had no additional information.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2025, and again on September 9, 2025, via
telephone. Director reported talking with Children’s Hospital
earlier in the day and learning Youth A reported being pushed by
Staff 2. Director denied seeing or hearing from any youth or staff
that Staff 2 pushed, slapped, or hit Youth A. Director stated Youth
A has made many allegations as he does not want to be at
Wolverine Center. Director described Youth A getting upset when
he does not get his way and going AWOL or saying negative
things about staff and youth.
Director stated Youth A injured his left wrist and had a cast and
later a brace on his left wrist (being investigated in
2025SIC000923). Director described Youth A going to the
emergency room for suicidal ideation on August 26, 2025, and
while Youth A was there, he stated his right wrist hurt. Director
reported she could not recall what the reason Youth A provided for
his right wrist hurting. Director stated Youth A had X-Rays while
at the emergency room but could not recall if he was provided with
a brace for the right wrist. Director denied Youth A ever reporting
Staff 2 pushed him causing injury to Youth A’s right wrist. Director
stated no youth in the program reported seeing or hearing of Staff
2 pushing Youth A causing Youth A to fall and hurt his right wrist.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2025. Supervisor described Youth A as being the
2

“black sheep” out of all the youth. Supervisor stated Youth A
picks on the other youth, will say negative and hurtful things to
youth about their families and ends up being left out because the
other youth do not want to do anything with Youth A. Supervisor
reported Youth A frequently talks about not wanting to be at
Wolverine Center and tries to do things Youth A believes will get
him removed from the facility. Supervisor described Youth A as
trying to get into fights with youth, going AWOL and walking to the
hospital or taking a bus to the hospital in order to be moved from
the facility. Supervisor denied ever seeing Staff 2 or any staff
member slap, push, or punch Youth A. Supervisor stated no
youth, including Youth A, have ever told him Youth A was
slapped, pushed or punched by a staff member.
Supervisor reported from what he could recall, Youth A had been
in a couple physical fights with other youth but mostly it is just
verbal arguments. Supervisor stated staff have had several
meetings with Youth A and the other youth in the unit about
getting along with one another, planned ignoring, and how words
affect people. Supervisor described staff intervening when there
were physical fights and redirecting when youth were verbally
arguing. Supervisor denied being aware of any staff member
allowing youth to fight and not intervene. Supervisor stated Youth
A had a cast and then a brace on his left wrist for a period of time,
so staff worked hard to make sure nothing became physical with
Youth A. Supervisor reported Youth A injured his thumb, so he
had a cast/brace (investigated in 2025SIC0000923).
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2025. Youth B described Youth A as “complicated,
having a lot of issues, throwing things at staff and kids and always
taunting us [youth].” Youth B stated when Youth A had a cast on
his arm he would try and hit people with it. Youth B reported staff
would have youth leave the unit or try and get Youth A to go to an
area away from the rest of the group. Youth B reported he
thought Youth A had a cast on his arm from doing something
“dumb on the playground.” Youth B stated Youth A was in a fight
with another youth, could not recall who the other youth was, but
staff separated the youths and the fight stopped. Youth B denied
ever seeing Staff 2 or any staff member slap, punch, or push
Youth A. Youth B stated, “if that happened, we’d all know about
it.” Youth B reported he did not have any concerns with staff at
the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2025. Youth C described Youth A as “talking a lot
3

of non-sense and crap to others.” Youth C stated Youth A “calls
kids bitches and says things about people’s parents.” Youth C
reported staff redirect Youth A but once “it’s said, it’s said.” Youth
C described getting into a fight with Youth A once because of
things Youth A was saying to him. Youth C stated staff
intervened, “they are typically on that stuff.” Youth C denied ever
seeing Staff 2 or any staff member slap, punch or push Youth A.
Youth C reported he has never heard Youth A say he was
slapped, punched or pushed by a staff member.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
September 4, 2025. Staff 1 denied ever seeing Staff 2 or any
staff member slap, punch or push Youth A. Staff 1 reported no
youth ever reported to her Youth A was slapped, punched or
pushed by a staff member. Staff 1 stated Youth A gets upset
when he is redirected and often says he does not want to be at
the facility. Staff 1 reported “it depends on the day” when
describing how Youth A gets along with his peers. Staff 1 stated
she could not recall any restraints with Youth A because of
physical fights between Youth A and his peers. Staff 1 described
Youth A getting into more verbal arguments with peers because of
what Youth A says to his peers then physical altercations. Staff 1
reported staff always try to redirect or remove the other youth from
the situation before the situation escalates and gets verbal. Staff
1 stated staff would intervene if any youth punched Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at Children’s Hospital
on September 4, 2025. Youth A denied ever being slapped by
any staff member. Youth A stated Staff 2 “kinda like pushed me to
the ground.” Youth A reported he believed the incident took place
about two weeks ago and that they [Staff 2 and Youth A] were
inside the facility. Youth A described the push taking place in
Youth A’s bedroom, later stated it was in the hallway and also
indicated he was not sure where he was when Staff 2 pushed him.
Youth A reported Staff 2 pushed Youth A from behind, with two
hands on Youth A’s back and Youth A landed on his “butt.” Youth
A later described landing on his side and hurting his wrist. Youth
A stated other youth, and staff saw Staff 2 push him, but Youth A
stated he could not recall the youth or staff’s names. Youth A
later stated no one was around when Staff 2 pushed him. Youth A
reported only being pushed one time by Staff 2. Youth A denied
ever being pushed by Staff 2 prior to this incident. Youth A stated
he spoke to the police about Staff 2 pushing him.
Youth A reported the Velcro brace on his wrist was from another
youth (investigated in 2025SIC0000885). Youth A stated he
4

“sometimes” gets along with the other youth at the facility. Youth
A described his peers as being “mean” to him. Youth A stated he
could not think of any examples of how his peers are mean to him.
Youth A reported he got into a fight with Youth C one time. Youth
A denied being injured from the fight. Youth A stated staff broke
up the fight and Youth A and Youth C had to stay away from each
other.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on September 5, 2025.
Staff 2 reported Youth A antagonizes his peers, picks on them to
get a rise which creates a beef between Youth A and his peers.
Staff 2 stated the altercations with the other youth do not go “blow
for blow, they are just verbal.” Staff 2 reported staff always
intervene and work on stopping the altercations before they do
become physical.
Staff 2 denied slapping, pushing or punching Youth A. Staff 2
denied seeing any staff member slap, push or punch Youth A.
Staff 2 reported he was not working when Youth A injured his wrist
or ankle. Staff 2 stated he believed Youth A injured his thumb
from another resident and his ankle was injured when Youth A
jumped from a structure on the playground.
Case Manager at Children’s Hospital was interviewed via
telephone on September 9, 2025. Case Manager stated Youth
A received X-rays on 09/02/2025 on his right wrist and there was
no injury visible.
Documents Reviewed:
• Email from Foster Care Worker dated September 9, 2025.
“On 08/27 when I had a visit with him, he had something on
his R wrist/arm and I put cast though I use cast/Velcro thing
interchangeably. Anyhow, in my notes and after reading I
do remember him saying that he had the cast on because a
child, who has autism, sat on his wrist on purpose. [Youth
A] said “it’s okay though, he apologized” and then also
showed me a scratch on R palm from a fall that came from
another peer at facility who he reports “punched him on top
of his head” and he fell.”
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had counseling forms for
something unrelated to interactions with youth and
completed the required Nonviolent Crisis Intervention
training on 9/18/2024.
• Behavior Notification Forms for Youth A dated 8/7/25,
8/18/25, and 8/25/25. Incidents describe Youth A removing
5

cast from his left hand several times, one time throwing it in
the trash can.
• Incident Report for Youth A dated 8/25/25 at 11:10PM.
Incident report outlines Youth A antagonizing and spitting
on another youth, that youth jumping on Youth A’s back
and hitting him. “Youth A was transported to Beaumont
Hospital where he received a brace on left hand where he
had a cast previous, nothing on right hand that was injured
tonight.”
• Behavior Notification form for Youth A dated 8/25/2025.
Note on form states, “[Youth A] received a brace on left
hand where he had a cast previous, nothing on right hand
that was injured tonight.”
• After Visit Summary for Youth A dated 8/26/25 at 2:24am.
Imaging tests for right hand and wrist, no injury.
Acetaminophen, take 1 tablet by mouth every six hours as
needed for pain.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as there was not enough
information to support a rule violation as Youth B, Youth C, Staff
1, Staff 2, and Supervisor denied Staff 2 slapped or pushed Youth
A, and Youth A denied being slapped by Staff 2 but stated he was
pushed by Staff 2. There were no videos from the incident. Youth
A told Complainant, Foster Care Worker and I different reasons as
to why his wrist was injured.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
